subject: Re: Thinking of improving the auto generation of test cases
msgSnippet: ... There are several great commercial tools that do automated test case creation. Feel free to experiment with testgen4j which is an open source project we
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "junitheadache" <bohs01@...> wrote:
>
> Hi all,
>
> I am currently working on auto generation of test cases for TDD for
> my honors year project. And was considering modifying JUnit such
> that it will auto generate some test cases based values flagged by
> users.
>
> E.g.,
> Public boolean isLegalInt(int x){
> /* input - 0 < x < 10, result - True*/
>
> }
> given a comment like the above will generate assert statements such
> as
> assertFalse(isLegalInt(0));
> assertTrue(isLegalInt(1));
> assertTrue(isLegalInt(9));
> assertFalse(isLegalInt(10));
>
> Thus, I am trying to locate the source code that generates the
> testclass template to implement the changes and I can't seem to find
> it anywhere. Any help would be greatly appreciated thankyou.
>
> p.s I am currently working with Junit 3.8.1
>
> Regards,
> Jimm
>

There are several great commercial tools that do automated test case
creation. Feel free to experiment with testgen4j which is an open
source project we created that builds on some other open source tools
(http://developer.spikesource.com/wiki/index.php/Projects:TestGen4J).

After a while its the management and maintenance of the test data that
becomes more of a challenge!

regards
calvin
